Class RoutingPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • Packet
      • RoutingPacket

  • public class RoutingPacket
extends Packet
    This class represents a packet which is sent by routers to communicate with each other.
    Author:
    Mark kaganovsky
    See Also:
    Packet, DataPacket, IPAddress

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoutingPacket() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean processFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
      Processes a packet which is found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
      boolean processNotFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
      Processes a packet which is not found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
      boolean readPacket(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      This method calls super.readPacket(scanner), it exists in order to get rid of the leading and trailing whitespace which could be in the port code.

      • Methods inherited from class Packet

        getDestNetwork, getPacketData

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • RoutingPacket

        public RoutingPacket()

    • Method Detail

      • readPacket

        public boolean readPacket(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        This method calls super.readPacket(scanner), it exists in order to get rid of the leading and trailing whitespace which could be in the port code.
        Overrides:
        readPacket in class Packet
        Parameters:
        scanner - A scanner object to read from.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the packet was valid or not (false = invalid).
        See Also:
        Packet.readPacket(Scanner)

      • processFoundPacket

        public boolean processFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
        Description copied from class: Packet
        Processes a packet which is found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
        Specified by:
        processFoundPacket in class Packet
        Parameters:
        port - The port code which this network can already be accessed by.
        Returns:
        false, do not add this packet to the routing table.

      • processNotFoundPacket

        public boolean processNotFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
        Description copied from class: Packet
        Processes a packet which is not found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
        Specified by:
        processNotFoundPacket in class Packet
        Parameters:
        port - The port code which this network can now be accessed by.
        Returns:
        true, add this packet to the routing table.
